BO.question: Where would you annotate your daily fuel consumption, violations, etc.?
BO.ref: 10.01 EXPLAIN/PERFORM OPERATING SF VESSELS (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: When should a vessel operator wear a PFD?
BO.answer: At any time they are on a boat
BO.ref: 10.03 EXPLAIN SAFETY EQUIPMENT REQUIREMENTS (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: T or F:  Do not travel off shore during a Small Craft Advisory
BO.ref: 10.04 EXPLAIN SEA STATE REQUIREMENTS (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: Name six pieces of safety equipment each SF vessel should have on hand.
BO.answer: The vessel will be equipped with an anchor attached to anchor line, fenders, throwable flotation device, spare personal flotation devices, a spare container of oil, operational mobile radio, fire extinguisher, “kill switch” lanyard (if equipped), dock lines, first-aid kit, siren, binoculars, tow line, signal flares and boating safety guides.
BO.ref: 10.03 EXPLAIN SAFETY EQUIPMENT REQUIREMENTS (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: If a commercial or private vessel enters the restricted area/basin, immediately give the __________________.
BO.ref: 10.05 EXPLAIN/PERFORM NAVY PATROL (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: If you hear “breakaway, breakaway, breakaway” over the radio during a Security Breach Red, what must you do?
BO.answer: Back off, out of the line of fire.
BO.ref: 10.05 EXPLAIN/PERFORM NAVY PATROL (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: With a warship in port, the SF patrol will be armed with a _______ and ______ rounds of ammunition.
BO.ref: 10.05 EXPLAIN/PERFORM NAVY PATROL (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: When a vessel is within the “Restricted Zone” (when activated), 45 SFS members conduct a vessel stop, treating it similar to _________ .
BO.ref: 10.01 EXPLAIN/PERFORM OPERATING SF VESSELS (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: Warships will be assigned  a radio call sign based upon berthing location.  If the vessel is o n Trident South wharf, its call sign would be _______
BO.ref: 10.05 EXPLAIN/PERFORM NAVY PATROL (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: When a war vessel is not in port, what would be your routine operation?
BO.answer: Conduct random patrols of the Poseidon Basin, Trident Basin and Navy associated assets. It is not required to carry a M240B when there is no HVA in port.
BO.ref: 10.05 EXPLAIN/PERFORM NAVY PATROL (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: In addition to the LMR and VHF, what other means of communications may be used (i.e. emergency)?
BO.ref: 10.02 EXPLAIN/PERFORM COMMUNICATIONS (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: If a vessel is equipped with this type of safety device, it will be attached to the operator at all times.
BO.ref: 10.01 EXPLAIN/PERFORM OPERATING SF VESSELS (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: Post change is conducted where?
BO.ref: 10.05 EXPLAIN/PERFORM NAVY PATROL (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: Re-fueling is conducted where?
BO.ref: 10.05 EXPLAIN/PERFORM NAVY PATROL (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: Which data buoys would you rely upon for current sea informations?
BO.ref: 10.04 EXPLAIN SEA STATE REQUIREMENTS (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: Which data buoys would you rely upon for current sea informations?
BO.ref: 10.04 EXPLAIN SEA STATE REQUIREMENTS (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: If either a “Security Breach Yellow” or “Security Breach Red” are implemented, what must be completed?
BO.ref: 10.05 EXPLAIN/PERFORM NAVY PATROL (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: If the vessel fails to heed your warnings after issuing the warning, notify BDOC and the HVAs in port that you have a _____________.
BO.ref: 10.05 EXPLAIN/PERFORM NAVY PATROL (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: 45 SFS water vessels will normally be operated at a speed which allows the operator to do what?
BO.ref: 10.01 EXPLAIN/PERFORM OPERATING SF VESSELS (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: Conduct a check for destructive devices, unauthorized divers or unusual circumstances under and around the Trident/Poseidon Wharfs, at least ________ checks throughout each shift and one hour prior to the arrival of any naval ship.
BO.ref: 10.05 EXPLAIN/PERFORM NAVY PATROL (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: How often should radio checks be conducted with in port war vessels.
BO.ref: 10.05 EXPLAIN/PERFORM NAVY PATROL (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: At no time will a boat patrol tow another vessel, other than 45 SFS vessels, without the direct approval of whom?
BO.ref: 10.01 EXPLAIN/PERFORM OPERATING SF VESSELS (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: During a dual boat escort, what must the clearing boat do upon arrival at the mouth of the port?
BO.ref: 10.05 EXPLAIN/PERFORM NAVY PATROL (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: Who is responsible for your wake and damages caused by your actions/negligence?
BO.ref: 10.01 EXPLAIN/PERFORM OPERATING SF VESSELS (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: If seas are in excess of _____, do not place the vessel in service.
BO.ref: 10.04 EXPLAIN SEA STATE REQUIREMENTS (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)

BO.question: The USCG provides current weather conditions and warnings on marine channel ______ at 0800L and every four hours thereafter.
BO.ref: 10.02 EXPLAIN/PERFORM COMMUNICATIONS (REF: 45 SFS OI 31-1 V3)
